meanings.definition: Lacking in quantity or quality; insufficient
meanings.sent1: The meager amount of food left in the fridge was not enough for a full meal.
meanings.sent2: The family could only afford a meager dinner of plain pasta and sauce.
meanings.sent3: His meager attempt at cooking resulted in a burnt mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The meager light of the dying candle barely illuminated the room.
meanings.sent5: The meager salary he earned made it hard to make ends meet.

meanings.sent1: The stray cat looked meager and hungry, with its ribs showing.
meanings.sent2: After being sick for weeks, she emerged from her room looking meager and pale.
meanings.sent3: The meager tree swayed in the wind, its branches looking frail and delicate.
meanings.sent4: The meager figure in the distance turned out to be a lost hiker in need of help.
meanings.sent5: The meager puppy wagged its tail weakly, looking for some food.

meanings.sent1: The meager broth lacked the savory flavor of a hearty soup.
meanings.sent2: The meager plot of the story left the readers wanting more depth.
meanings.sent3: His meager singing voice struggled to fill the empty auditorium.
meanings.sent4: The meager applause at the end of the performance reflected the audience's disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The meager colors of the painting failed to capture the vibrancy of the artist's usual work.
